sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is distributive over union.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. What is the Cartesian product of A and B? Then, what is the union of the Cartesian products of {1} and {3, 4} and {2} and {3, 4}? Finally, prove that the union of these two Cartesian products is equal to the Cartesian product of the union of {1} and {2} and the union of {3, 4}.
